segments.text: Okay, I can't sleep. My brain won't shut off about this album.
What if it's not good enough? What if people don't connect with it the way they did with the EP?
The EP was so raw, so immediate. This feels... I don't know, more calculated? Even with the analog gear.
Maybe I'm overthinking it. Jessica seemed confident today. The band loves the new material.
But what do I think? Do I love it? Or am I just trying to recreate what worked before?
That song we worked on yesterday, 'Morning Light'... that one feels genuine. I believe in that one.
And 'Echoes' from last month. That's strong too. Okay, so there's good stuff here.
I think I'm just scared. This is the first full album. It's a big deal. There's pressure.
The label is investing money. We're planning a tour. What if I let everyone down?
Okay, breathe. Let me think about this rationally. What would I tell someone else in this situation?
I'd say... trust the process. You've worked hard. The songs are honest. That's all you can control.
I can't control how people receive it. I can only make something I'm proud of.
And honestly? I am proud of most of it. There's a couple tracks I'm still not sure about, but overall...
Overall, it's good work. It's me. It's authentic, even if it's different from the EP.
Different is okay. Different is growth. I need to stop comparing everything to the EP.
Alright. I feel a bit better. I'm going to make some chamomile tea and try to sleep.
Tomorrow I'll focus on finishing that bridge for track six. One thing at a time.

environment.background_sounds: quiet nighttime, distant traffic, rustling sheets
